subject: Career
title: Death by Meeting: Why Most Meetings Fail
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Death by Meeting: Why Most Meetings Fail.

hook.text: Executives spend 23 hours per week in meetings. A Harvard study found 71% of those are unproductive.

buildup.text: Most meetings fail for the same reasons: no agenda, wrong people, no decisions, and no follow-up.

discovery.text: Jeff Bezos's two-pizza rule: if two pizzas can't feed the group, the meeting has too many people.

twist.text: The silent cost: a one-hour meeting with ten people costs ten person-hours. Multiply by yearly meetings.

climax.text: Every meeting needs: a purpose statement, an agenda, the minimum attendees, and a documented outcome.

punchline.text: If a meeting has no agenda, it has no purpose.

quiz.question: What percentage of meetings are unproductive according to Harvard research?
